page.title: 13An Eckington person part2
page.content: The entertainments were dancing, social clubs and drama clubs. For breakfast they had bacon and eggs. Villagers had toilets in sheds at the bottom of their gardens. They had to bath in a metal tub by the fire; before water was installed, they had to go to wells and collect water in buckets.{What Mr. Perks said:-}Mr Perks was 2years 3 months old when he started school. He had to walk one and a quarter miles to school. At school he didn't have school dinners, but had two dripping sandwiches and a bottle of cold cocoa. He left school at the age of twelve to work on a farm, his father died the same year in the First World War. People used to auction meat. The meat was auctioned in The Shambles, Worcester, a leg of lamb cost sixpence. The first car that came into the village was in 1919.
